overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to forecasting 96-hour transformer load data using limited historical data. The analyst identifies daily seasonality, acknowledges data constraints (only 4 days of history), and selects a simple averaging method due to the inability to capture weekly patterns or complex trends. The approach includes data inspection, pattern recognition, hourly mean calculations, and output formatting with rounding.
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) restricts complex modeling, favoring simple averaging
Explicit handling of daily patterns through hourly mean aggregation
Rounding outputs to 3 decimals to match input data precision
Rejection of advanced models (SARIMA/ETS) due to insufficient training data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines data inspection, method justification, and detailed computations, but relies on simple heuristics due to data limitations.
